name: Club Quarters Gracechurch

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We got a good price for this hotel and it really is in a good location nr Monument and Bank Underground stops. As others have said the area is pretty dead on Sat night but your only a short ride in the tube away from busier areas. Would stay again. The room was fine if a bit small compared to some other hotel chains but very peaceful. We didn't eat in the hotel so can't comment on ther food.
reviews.title: Good Stay, Good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We got a good deal via priceline UK & we were very please with our choice. The staff were very friendly & helpful, I had telephoned beforehand to request a room on a high floor if possible ( to avoid traffic noise) this wish was granted & we were given one on the top floor, I think it must have been an upgrade as it was very large & spacious. For us the location was good, very easy walk from Bank tube station & we found plenty open in the area even at the weekend (I bought a jacket in T.K.Maxx just down the road.)
reviews.title: Enjoyable stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had been recommended “Fora” restaurant (booked through top table) which was within easy walking distance -this was excellent, good food & nice atmosphere.
reviews.title: Disappointing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We would happily stay at Clubquaters again.
reviews.title: GOOD LOCATION PRICE QUALITY, took it for the price and location

reviews.text: My husband and I thought we'd book somewhere slightly nicer than the place we usually stay in London this weekend as we were in London for our first wedding anniversary. We couldn't afford to go crazy however and this place looked like good value. Unfortunately we wished we'd stayed at our usual place.
reviews.title: Nice stay

reviews.text: Good hotel, particularly for the price. The rooms were clean and nice (I didn't think they felt cheap like other reviews have stated). The hotel was very busy while we were there and the staff was disorganized. They were very pleasant and accommodating, but simply seemed unable to handle the volume of traffic. Although the lobby offered a nice selection of free coffee, teas and treats, the supplies often ran low and their automatic coffee machine ran dry all morning. One note about the location: this hotel is east of the main tourist zone and is in the financial district. It's in a clean and safe location with great underground/subway access. But, as with all things in London, even the underground is expensive and takes time. We were there on a bank holiday weekend and were forced to walk a fair distance before finding any selection of open restaurants. Having said all this, for the price, we'd stay there again.
reviews.title: Solid choice with small limitations

reviews.text: Club Quarters is definitely designed for the budget business traveller, and for those with business in The City in London, it is a great location, everything is within walking distance, and that's a huge plus. Another plus is the wonderful staff, who are courteous, informed, and eager to assist. Nothing to fault there. The iffy and big downside to Club Quarters Gracechurch are the rooms themselves and the general aesthetics of the hotel itself. The rooms, even the "suites", are small, and the decor theme, green carpets, walls, and dark wood, make the rooms feel dark and claustrophobic and dingy -- not pleasant. The bathrooms are cramped, the fixtures basic and utilitarian, it all feels cheap. And even when traveling on business an hotel room is not just "a place to sleep", especially when the bed is hard to sleep on, as these beds are very much on the firm side. The rooms do nothing to lift the spirits. Even the hallways give you the feeling of being in a labyrinthine hostel. The theme of the dark extends to the restaurant, Gaucho, which is in the basement and painted black! The upside there is that the breakfast is quite decent, and the coffee good. Try to ignore the throbbing disco music at 7:30 a.m. Given the great staff and location, Club Quarters would benefit from a real re-design and refit, as it has the potential to be vey good.
reviews.title: Great location, great staff, iffy accommodation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hoter was very nice staff were very helpful and polite. The rooms are smalls but very well organized. Free coffee and water is available. The hotel is located in a business banking area. there are very few places to eat at night.
reviews.title: Decent hotel

reviews.text: The easiest hotel experience I have had in recent years - automatic check-in and check-out, perfect amenities, excellent location. Besides the fact that it's in an older building, there is nothing quaint about the feel - it's a renovated business hotel experience. 24-hour coffee, espresso, and tea machine. Filtered water in the lobby and on every floor by the elevator. Breakfast cereal bars, fresh fruit in the lobby. It's relatively high-end, without frills, but they thought of everything. It was not a personalized experience, but more than adequate, and at a high level. Like a 5-star, hi-tech hotel. Large work-style desk in the room, excellent wi-fi, with interesting books on London on the desk along with a dictionary and thesaurus. It was interesting, completely satisfactory, and I would stay again. If staying slightly closer to the center (though this is quite central), or having something more charming is important, there are surely other options. But the quality and price here was excellent.
reviews.title: Efficient, clean, comfortable

reviews.text: I was traveling on business. Club Quarters would not have been my first choice (the standard first choice is right next to the office), but came up as an alternative. Not far away and very reasonable price. The room, bed and service were all very good. Nothing particularly stylish about it, but nothing to complain about. That said, if you want your business hotel to reassure you about how hip you are, this isn't the place.
reviews.title: Very good for the price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Not quite club quarters really, but well placed if you're in the City. Pleasant welcome from receptionist who is at a desk around a corner in the ground floor lobby. The rest of it is the lounge, which has books, TV and drinks machine. Decor rather dark but the lounge is functional and nice enough.
reviews.title: Unusual but convenient

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a "suite" which contained a double bed, one temporary looking single (all nicely made up) with a sofa and chairs and a kitchen corner with a microwave. Room was not overlarge, but it was very clean, and the ensuite shower room was small but sparkling. Room wasn't really big enough for two, three would have been really too much, but it was quiet and sleep quality excellent.
reviews.title: Great location - close to several attractions!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We avoided breakfast in the basement restaurant as this was £14 odd per person. However, there is a Wetherspoons pub right next door in what I think was an old banking hall, which does good cheap breakfasts and meals (though its opening hours are City ones and not open Sundays). There are also various Pret a Manger outlets in the vicinity.
reviews.title: Good deal in central London

reviews.text: Very nice, and ideal for the City, but not I suspect for a social trip, as it's away from the bright lights.
reviews.title: good hotel for week staying

reviews.text: We really liked this property and the location. We were clsoe to a subway staion, department store with awesome grocery right in. We were able to walk to Thames River to catch a river among a lot of places within walking distace. This is primarily a business area but has some options for Metro. I liked the concept of the hotel with the nice big lobby, library and coffe tea center but the water and water bottles available to guests on each floor was one of the best hotel ammenities I have seen provided in a long time!
reviews.title: Ideal location if working in the City!

reviews.text: The hotel was good but would not stay in this particular hotel again due to location. Nothing is open over the weekend not even pubs. The area is definitely for Monday to Friday office workers. Hotel staff were very helpful and polite but I prefered staying in club quarters in St Pauls.
reviews.title: Not for weekend breaks

reviews.text: Despite the unusual name, this is a good quality, efficient, extremely friendly and reasonably priced hotel. Good sized room and well planned bathroom. I didn't try the breakfast because it was £14 extra and there's plenty of other places nearby.
reviews.title: Great City of London hotel - reasonably priced for area

reviews.text: The hotel is within walking distance of most places in the city. There are several superb pubs within a minute of the hotel. There is even an independent pub attached to the hotel itself where you don't even have to go outside - very handy if it's raining.
reviews.title: I love this place

reviews.text: I would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Perfect weekend break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I love its dark retro decor. It really appealed to me.
reviews.title: Comfort and convenience at a good price

description: Private, full service club-like hotel with 203 rooms located in the historic district of the City of London. Minutes from Leaden Hall Market shopping area and close to the Tower of London, London Bridge and St. Paul’s Cathedral. Nestled among charming pedestrian streets linking London's ancient churches, parks and public houses. Club Quarters is the best value hotel based on quality and prime location. Club Quarters provide:• Safe, restricted entry• Instant registration and check out• Free high speed internet access throughout the hotel• Onsite restaurant • Multi-menu in room dining options (through onsite restaurant and many local restaurants)• Refrigerator and microwave available• Unlimited complimentary chilled purified bottled water • 2 meeting and event rooms available (maximum reception style 100 people)• Free use of computer/printer • Ergonomic workstations• State of the art guest rooms with premium bedding• Contemporary furnishings• Flat panel HD TVs• Complimentary coffee and tea• 24 hour guest service desk • Fitness room • Exercise equipment delivered to guest room upon request • Corporate Apartments available • Value rates• Government per diem rates 365 day a year with valid ID.
